meanings.definition: The property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye as a result of the way it reflects or emits light.
meanings.sent1: The rainbow displayed a beautiful array of color.
meanings.sent2: She loved to paint with all the colors of the rainbow.
meanings.sent3: The color of the sky changed as the sun set.
meanings.sent4: His artwork was a burst of color on the blank canvas.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant color of the flowers brightened up the room.

meanings.definition: A substance used to give something a particular color.
meanings.sent1: She mixed blue and yellow to create a new color.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully selected the perfect color for the painting.
meanings.sent3: The color spilled on the floor, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: The color of the dye transformed the fabric completely.
meanings.sent5: The color of the walls matched the furniture perfectly.

meanings.definition: To change the color of something by applying a substance to it.
meanings.sent1: She decided to color her hair a vibrant red.
meanings.sent2: He used a brush to color the picture with bright hues.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they colored outside the lines.
meanings.sent4: The artist carefully colored each petal of the flower.
meanings.sent5: The chef colored the icing with natural ingredients.
